dt: {d_link|alcohol use disorder|alcohol use disorder}; alcohol-use disorder

dt.t: Alcohol use disorder ({wi}AUD{/wi}) and other substance use problems are considered diseases like any other, but are stigmatized as moral failure by many.

At the start of {wi}AUD{/wi} treatment, the average percentage of heavy drinking days among study participants was 83 percent. In addition, each of the participants had, on average, 4.5 symptoms of alcohol withdrawal.
